snippet: Daytime temperatures were near zero degrees in many places, as a cold blast of wind and snow led to widespread school closings and work delays.
abstract: Bitterly frigid air descends across Midwest and New England, shutting down schools and hampering traffic and public transportation; daytime temperatures hover around zero degrees in many areas, and icy winds cause wind chill to possibly fall to minus 40 degrees in some places.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MITCH SMITH
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood from Boston; Carson Vaughan from Lincoln, Neb.; Lacey Russell from Tupelo, Miss.; Shelia Eldred from Minneapolis; and Conor Devlin from Northfield, Minn.

lead_paragraph: Daytime temperatures were near zero degrees in many places, as a cold blast of wind and snow led to widespread school closings and work delays.

headline.main: Midwest and New England Are Shivering and Coping
headline.print_headline: Midwest and New England Are Shivering and Coping
